column1: with Article 89 and Article 90 of the Constitution of Sri Lanka.

column2: the  1st  Respondent  being  elected  and  continuing  to  hold  office  as  a  Member  of
Parliament is ultra vires the Constitution and the Parliamentary Elections Act.
the  taking  of  oaths  by  the  1st  Respondent  as  a  Member  of  Parliament  and  the
functioning of the 1st Respondent as a Member of Parliament is a nullity.
the actions and omissions of the 1st Respondent are tantamount to a subversion of
the franchise and a misleading of the members of the general public.
